file_content.text: You've saved my life. And, I suppose, some of my men's as well. I'll remember this.
I have the data, Commander. The Sand People were insignificant.
My lord, you are a marvel. Worth more than my entire company put together.
I've returned with your black box. I hope it was worth wasting my time.
I am mortified that you've gone to such trouble for me, my lord. I'll have someone shot for this at once.
One black box, as requested. There is, of course, the matter of my fee.
If I could pay you your weight in credits, hunter, I would. This hardly seems sufficient.
I believe this is the black box recorder you were looking for?
You've done me an enormous favor, and don't think I'll forget it.
I can hardly wait to report this mission a success.
If the black box isn't at the crash site, then the blasted Sand People have taken it. Good luck.
This is preposterous! How can the so-called cream of the Imperial military fail against a bunch of alien savages?
I'll have to have the entire company executed for ineptitude! Have you any idea how much paperwork that requires?
This would be laughable, if it weren't the end of my career.
You should be more cautious when addressing a Sith.
Manners, Commander.
I... yes. I beg your pardon, my lord. I meant no disrespect.
I'm quite certain I didn't say "Please, expendable worm, tell me about your life."
Mind yourself, slave.
My apologies, my lord.
Unless you're talking about credits, I don't care about your problems.
Why are you talking to me?
Ah, you're a bounty hunter, aren't you? Perhaps you might consider a business arrangement?
There's probably an execution order being signed for you right now.
Or the end of your life.
Wonderful. Say, how would you feel about undertaking a mission of critical importance for the Empire?
Could be worse.
Of course, my superiors will probably have me executed as well.
Why don't you stop ranting and tell me what's going on?
What are you talking about?
One of our transports carrying some critical data was shot down over the Dune Sea.
So far, our best and brightest have been unable to handle the Sand People. We can't even approach the crash site.
I suppose I could do battle with some savages.
I'll be generous and help out.
Not much of a challenge.
You'll... help? Really?
Assuming the idiot natives haven't fed it to a bantha or something, everything we need is in the ship's black box.
If it's not at the crash site, the savages have likely carried it off.
This doesn't concern me in the slightest.
I don't care. [Refuse quest]
I hope I get to see my men shot before my own execution papers are signed.
I can't speak right now. I'm too enraged by incompetence.
